quest.name: The Business of Blacksmithing
journal: Forgemaster Brithael seems upset. Perhaps there is something you can do to help.

Forgemaster Brithael has no interest in matters of coin, but has nevertheless been ordered by Forgemaster H'naanza of the Armorers' Guild to find a way to increase exports to Gridania. This requires him to work closely with a trader named Faezahr, whom he seems loath to meet. Speak with the merchant outside the guild on the forgemaster's behalf.

Faezahr wastes no time explaining how best to approach the Gridanians. However, before he will agree to negotiate on the guild's behalf, he requires samples of merchandise to present to potential buyers. Craft a bronze spatha and a spiked bronze labrys for the seasoned trader.

Having initially dismissed you as a mere errand girlboy, Faezahr is impressed by the quality of your craftsmanship, and readily agrees to present the weapons you made to his Gridanian contacts.

※The next blacksmith quest will be available from Brithael upon reaching level 20.
objectives: Deliver a bronze spatha and a spiked bronze labrys to Faezahr.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Ah, hells─not now, lasslad! Can't ye see I'm strugglin' with a matter o' great import?

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Bein' forgemaster ain't all drink an' debauchery─'specially when H'naanza's breathin' down me neck.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: We're a business, she says, an' it's our job to ensure Naldiq & Vymelli's stays profitable or some such bollocks.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: To which I says, “Now look here, ye greedy shrew─we're makin' a mint off our commission from the Maelstrom, ain't we!?” Well, I mayn't've said shrew... Anyroad, the greedy shrew then starts yatterin' on about expandin' into new bleedin' markets...

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Says we should be sellin' more to the treefolk in Gridania─says I should be the one to develop a “plan of action.”

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Seven hells, lasslad─I'm a smitty, not a merchant! I've never even been to bleedin' Gridania!

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Oh, an' it gets worse. See, we need a man with connections, don't we─someone as can make arrangements with the treefolk.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: So H'naanza goes an' finds one─right clever bastard by the sound of it─an' orders me to go an' meet him. So I goes an' meets him, only to find it's none other than bleedin' Faezahr. An' I'd sooner bash me own teeth in than talk to that piece o'─

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Wait a minute! I know how to deal with this! You can talk to him! Ye'll help ol' Brithael handle this Gridanian nonsense, won't ye? 'Course ye will! Go on then, chop-chop!

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Here on Brithael's behalf, you say? I might've guessed...

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: <spit> That whoreson doesn't realize the trouble he's in.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text:
...Well, it's his neck.
I'll work with you, smith, and I'll even keep my diction simple. Taking instruction from that drunkard will have dulled your wits. Now listen.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Dealing with Gridanians is no different from dealing with anyone else. Everyone has needs─it's just a matter of identifying and fulfilling them.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Anyone with half a brain─which discounts your mentor─knows that the forestborn do not want for wood or leather goods. You'd have more luck selling brine to a fishback.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: What they do lack is steel.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Theirs is an insular, isolated nation that has long sought to survive without relying overmuch on foreign trade.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: But the Calamity changed all that.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Half a decade on, and with no end to the rebuilding in sight, they have been forced to open their gates to adventurers. And where there are adventurers, there's demand for weapons and armor.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Quality weapons and armor, mind you. My Gridanian contacts would accept nothing less.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: I will need some samples to show them. Bring me a bronze spatha and a spiked bronze labrys for this purpose.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Bring me a bronze spatha and a spiked bronze labrys. Until I have them in my hands, we've nothing more to discuss.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Hmmm. These will require closer inspection. Inside, smith.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: You made these weapons? I must confess, the quality is quite good...

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: I thought you no more than Brithael's errand girlboy, but it seems I was wrong. Only a true smith could have made these pieces.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: As I rather suspect you are aware, a poorly wrought weapon can cost a man his life. Be it brittle, prone to blunting, or unevenly weighted, every flaw will serve to hinder its owner on the battlefield.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Not so this spatha. Well-tempered and perfectly balanced, it is a weapon fit for a warrior. Hells, with a blade like this, even I could probably best a beast or two.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: And this labrys is a work of art as well. Simple, solid, and more than capable of cleaving a fishback in two.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: If even a relative newcomer to the guild can produce work of this quality, then my contacts will have naught to worry about. These samples should convince them of that.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: ...It seems you've saved your mentor's job.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: You just leave the rest to me, smith. There's nothing easier than selling an excellent product.

obj.n: By the Sweat of Your Brow
